page.title: 17Peoples Life in Villages.
page.content: No school or playschool in village. Preschool children go to Pentlow. Primary age children to Bulmer or Belchamp St Pauls or to private school in Sudbury or Stoke-by-Clare. Senior children to Hedingham Comprehensive school, traveling by bus daily or to private school daily, weekly or longer term boarding. Almost no employment in villages, some employment on local on farms, by Anglian Water Authority, most people travel to Sudbury or Halstead, or even daily to London. Labour relations good. Employment rate generally good also. Many pensioners in area, especially Belchamp Walter so fair amount of poverty tho' many people happy to live below state poverty line and proud to be able to manage. Many are unaware of entitlements or too proud to claim.
